title: About Gigaverse
text: Gigaverse is an epic crypto RPG built by GLHF, live on Abstract and powered by Proof of Play. Players progress through the world, upgrade characters, collect rare items, and more.

title: Getting Started
text: Start playing by progressing through activities like combat and fishing, collecting items/materials, and upgrading your character and gear over time.

title: Abstract XP
text: Abstract XP is a progression/engagement concept used across the Abstract ecosystem. In Gigaverse docs, it’s part of the Abstract Eco section alongside stubs and badges.

title: Crafting Overview
text: Crafting uses different stations (like Alchemy Bench and Workbench) to create items/materials. Some activities require crafted tools (for example, hands used to break pots).

title: Alchemy Bench
text: The Alchemy Bench is a crafting station used to create and combine specific materials/items. It’s listed under Crafting & Stations.

title: Workbench
text: The Workbench is a crafting station. It’s required for crafting hands (like Paper Hands and Rock Hands) which are used to break pots.

title: Factions
text: Factions are an in-game system that can affect progression and access to faction-related activities/features. The docs include a dedicated Factions section and a Faction Altar Room page.

title: Faction Altar Room
text: Faction Altar Room is a faction-related location/feature documented under the Factions section.

title: Pots
text: Pots contain utility items. There are two types: Blue and Brown. You need 5 Energy and Hands (crafted in the Workbench) to break pots.

title: Pots
text: Blue pots can be broken with Paper Hands. They may contain: Giga Shards, Dungeon Scrap, Wood, Stone, and a Glass Orb (Rare).

title: Pots
text: Brown pots can be broken with Rock Hands. They may contain: Giga Shards, Dungeon Scrap, Stone, Wood, Bone, Fiber, Blank Tomes, Small or Medium consumables, or a Ruby Key (Epic).

title: Chests
text: Chests contain a variety of items. Currently there are two types: Normal Chest and Juice Chest.

title: Chests
text: Normal Chest is available for all players (juiced or not). Location: bottom of the map, on the right side of the fishing area. Can be claimed once per week. Contains common crafting materials.

title: Chests
text: Juice Chest is available exclusively for Giga Juice enjoyers. Location: top of the map, on the left side of the Dungetron area across the bridge. Can be claimed once per week. Contains exclusive charm crafting materials such as Hexchain, Sapphire, and Soulmint.

title: In-Game Trading
text: Gigamarket is part of the In-Game Trading section. It’s where players interact with market-style trading features.

title: In-Game Trading
text: Traveling Merchants are part of the In-Game Trading section. They act as roaming vendor/trader features within the game’s ecosystem.

title: Combat
text: Dungetron is the core combat dungeon content listed under Combat. It’s a major activity area referenced by other systems (like the Juice Chest location near the Dungetron area).

title: Fishing
text: Fishing is a major activity area. The Normal Chest is located near the fishing area (bottom of the map, right side).

title: Giga Juice
text: Giga Juice is a premium/enhanced access state. Some rewards/features are exclusive to Giga Juice enjoyers, like the Juice Chest.

title: Fair Play Rules
text: Gigaverse includes Fair Play Rules in its General section. These rules define acceptable behavior and help protect the game economy and players.
